meanings.definition: To applaud or show approval by clapping.
meanings.sent1: The audience calps loudly after the amazing performance.
meanings.sent2: People often calps at the end of a good movie.
meanings.sent3: The children calps excitedly when the magician made the rabbit disappear.
meanings.sent4: The sound of calps filled the stadium like a thunderous wave.
meanings.sent5: She calps with joy as her team scores the winning goal.

meanings.definition: The act of clapping or applauding.
meanings.sent1: The calps of the crowd echoed through the hall.
meanings.sent2: A round of calps greeted the speaker at the conference.
meanings.sent3: The calps of the audience sounded like rain on a tin roof.
meanings.sent4: The calps of approval were music to the performer's ears.
meanings.sent5: The calps of the fans reverberated in the stadium.
